intro: Polycarpon lancifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved morning glory, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its trumpet-shaped flowers and climbing habit. The plant features alternate, lanceolate leaves that are often hairy, and its flowers are typically blue or purple in color. It produces small, spherical berries that contain the seeds. Polycarpon lancifolium is often found in disturbed soils and can be considered a weed in agricultural settings.
